events.message: The customer submitted a claim regarding a recent car collision that occurred on April 28th. The vehicle sustained significant damage.
The claim was categorized under auto accident after reviewing the claim report and the description provided by the claimant.
A claims agent was assigned to the case to manage communication and ensure all necessary documentation is collected efficiently.
The claimant was notified that the auto accident claim has been officially acknowledged and is under review by the insurance company.
Requested a police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates to support the processing of the auto accident claim.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, photographs, and repair estimate from the mechanic.
Investigation begun to verify the details of the collision and confirm the authenticity of submitted documentation for the claim.
The investigation confirmed the circumstances of the accident match the claimantâ€™s report and supporting evidence is valid.
A settlement offer covering the vehicle repair costs and a rental car reimbursement was proposed and sent to the customer.
The claimant responded positively to the proposed settlement offer and expressed gratitude for the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department based on the investigation outcome and customer agreement to the settlement.
Payment was issued to the repair shop directly and reimbursement processed for the rental vehicle as per the settlement agreement.
The auto accident claim was closed after payment issuance and confirmation from the claimant that repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All case files and correspondence were archived following the closure of the claim for long-term record keeping and auditing purposes.
